visitedCities.name: Dublin
visitedCities.description: Capital and largest city of Ireland, known for its literary history and vibrant culture.

visitedCities.name: Madrid
visitedCities.description: Capital of Spain, famous for its art museums and beautiful parks.

visitedCities.name: Paris
visitedCities.description: Capital of France, the City of Light known for its art, fashion, and cuisine.

visitedCities.name: Beijing
visitedCities.description: Capital of China, a city rich in history with modern developments.

visitedCities.name: Shanghai
visitedCities.description: China's largest city and global financial hub with impressive skyline.

visitedCities.name: Lisbon
visitedCities.description: Capital of Portugal, known for its colorful buildings, historic trams, and beautiful coastline.

visitedCities.name: Galway
visitedCities.description: Vibrant coastal city in western Ireland, famous for its arts scene and traditional Irish culture.

visitedCities.name: Belfast
visitedCities.description: Capital of Northern Ireland, known for its maritime heritage, Titanic Belfast museum, vibrant murals, and rich industrial history.

visitedCities.name: Porto
visitedCities.description: Portugal's second-largest city, renowned for its port wine and stunning riverside architecture.

visitedCities.name: Zaragoza
visitedCities.description: Historic city in northeastern Spain, known for the Basilica of Our Lady of the Pillar.

visitedCities.name: Barcelona
visitedCities.description: Catalonia's capital, famous for Gaudí's architecture, beaches, and vibrant culture.

visitedCities.name: Amsterdam
visitedCities.description: Capital of the Netherlands, known for its canals, museums, and cycling culture.

visitedCities.name: Stockholm
visitedCities.description: Capital of Sweden, built on 14 islands and known for its beautiful archipelago.

visitedCities.name: Brussels
visitedCities.description: Capital of Belgium and the EU, famous for its medieval architecture and chocolate.

visitedCities.name: Athens
visitedCities.description: Capital of Greece, the cradle of democracy and home to ancient landmarks like the Acropolis.

visitedCities.name: Rome
visitedCities.description: Capital of Italy, the Eternal City filled with ancient history, art, and incredible cuisine.

visitedCities.name: Naples
visitedCities.description: Historic city in southern Italy, birthplace of pizza and gateway to the Amalfi Coast.

visitedCities.name: Venice
visitedCities.description: Unique floating city built on canals, famous for its gondolas, art, and romantic atmosphere.

visitedCities.name: Manchester
visitedCities.description: Industrial city in northern England, known for its music scene, football clubs, and cultural heritage.

visitedCities.name: Edinburgh
visitedCities.description: Capital of Scotland, famous for its medieval Old Town, Edinburgh Castle, and annual festivals.

visitedCities.name: Glasgow
visitedCities.description: Scotland's largest city, known for its Victorian architecture, vibrant arts scene, and friendly locals.

visitedCities.name: Tokyo
visitedCities.description: Capital of Japan, a bustling metropolis blending traditional culture with cutting-edge technology.

visitedCities.name: Seoul
visitedCities.description: Capital of South Korea, a dynamic city known for K-pop, technology, and vibrant street food culture.

visitedCities.name: Sydney
visitedCities.description: Australia's largest city, famous for the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and beautiful beaches.

visitedCities.name: Wellington
visitedCities.description: Capital of New Zealand, known for its vibrant arts scene, craft beer, and stunning harbor views.

visitedCities.name: Dunedin
visitedCities.description: Historic city in New Zealand's South Island, known for its Scottish heritage and unique wildlife.

visitedCities.name: Canberra
visitedCities.description: Capital of Australia, a planned city known for its national institutions and beautiful gardens.

visitedCities.name: Cairns
visitedCities.description: Tropical city in northern Australia, gateway to the Great Barrier Reef and Daintree Rainforest.

visitedCities.name: Quito
visitedCities.description: Capital of Ecuador, a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its well-preserved colonial center and high altitude.

visitedCities.name: Calgary
visitedCities.description: Major city in Alberta, Canada, known for the Calgary Stampede and proximity to the Canadian Rockies.

visitedCities.name: Toronto
visitedCities.description: Canada's largest city, a multicultural metropolis known for the CN Tower and vibrant neighborhoods.

visitedCities.name: Ottawa
visitedCities.description: Capital of Canada, known for Parliament Hill, national museums, and the Rideau Canal.

visitedCities.name: Montreal
visitedCities.description: Quebec's largest city, famous for its French culture, festivals, and historic Old Montreal.

visitedCities.name: Edmonton
visitedCities.description: Capital of Alberta, Canada, known for its festivals, river valley parks, and oil industry.

visitedCities.name: Vancouver
visitedCities.description: Coastal city in British Columbia, known for its stunning natural setting between mountains and ocean, diverse culture, and outdoor recreation opportunities.

visitedCities.name: Whistler
visitedCities.description: World-renowned ski resort town in British Columbia, host of 2010 Winter Olympics alpine events, famous for Whistler Blackcomb ski area and year-round outdoor activities.

visitedCities.name: Revelstoke
visitedCities.description: Mountain town in British Columbia's Columbia Mountains, renowned for deep powder skiing, heli-skiing, and as a gateway to stunning alpine wilderness and national parks.

visitedCities.name: Banff
visitedCities.description: Iconic mountain town in Alberta's Canadian Rockies, located in Banff National Park and famous for its stunning alpine scenery, hot springs, and world-class skiing.

visitedCities.name: Jasper
visitedCities.description: Charming mountain town in Alberta's Jasper National Park, known for its pristine wilderness, dark sky preserve, and access to glaciers, lakes, and wildlife.

visitedCities.name: Mexico City
visitedCities.description: Capital of Mexico, one of the world's largest cities with rich Aztec and colonial history.

visitedCities.name: Tijuana
visitedCities.description: Border city in Baja California, Mexico, known for its vibrant culture and proximity to San Diego.

visitedCities.name: Ensenada
visitedCities.description: Coastal city in Baja California, Mexico, famous for its wine region and Pacific Ocean beaches.

visitedCities.name: Frankfurt
visitedCities.description: Major financial hub in Germany, known for its skyline, international airport, and banking district.

visitedCities.name: Cozumel
visitedCities.description: Island paradise off Mexico's Caribbean coast, famous for world-class diving and Mayan ruins.

visitedCities.name: Kingston
visitedCities.description: Capital of Jamaica, birthplace of reggae music and home to Bob Marley's legacy.

visitedCities.name: Belize City
visitedCities.description: Former capital of Belize, a Caribbean coastal city known for its colonial architecture and proximity to the Belize Barrier Reef.

visitedCities.name: Deauville
visitedCities.description: Elegant seaside resort town in Normandy, France, famous for its film festival, horse racing, and Belle Époque architecture.

visitedCities.name: Milan
visitedCities.description: Fashion and design capital of Italy, known for La Scala opera house, high-end shopping, and modern architecture.

visitedCities.name: Bologna
visitedCities.description: Historic university city in northern Italy, famous for its medieval towers, porticoes, and exceptional cuisine.

visitedCities.name: Salobreña
visitedCities.description: Picturesque white village on Spain's Costa Tropical, perched on a rocky outcrop overlooking the Mediterranean Sea.

visitedCities.name: Toledo
visitedCities.description: Medieval city in central Spain, UNESCO World Heritage site known as the 'City of Three Cultures' for its Christian, Muslim, and Jewish heritage.

visitedCities.name: Liverpool
visitedCities.description: Historic port city in northwest England, birthplace of The Beatles and home to iconic waterfront landmarks.

visitedCities.name: Inverness
visitedCities.description: Capital of the Scottish Highlands, gateway to Loch Ness and known for its stunning Highland scenery.

visitedCities.name: Port-au-Prince
visitedCities.description: Capital of Haiti, a vibrant Caribbean city known for its rich culture, art, and resilient spirit.

visitedCities.name: Reykjavik
visitedCities.description: Capital of Iceland, the world's northernmost capital city, known for its colorful buildings, geothermal pools, and Northern Lights.

visitedCities.name: Guangzhou
visitedCities.description: Major port city in southern China, known for its Cantonese cuisine, trading history, and modern skyline.

visitedCities.name: Hong Kong
visitedCities.description: International financial hub and former British colony, famous for its skyline, dim sum, and East-meets-West culture.

visitedCities.name: Yangshuo
visitedCities.description: Picturesque town in southern China, renowned for its dramatic karst mountain landscapes along the Li River.

visitedCities.name: Chamonix
visitedCities.description: World-famous Alpine resort town in France, birthplace of extreme skiing and home to the first Winter Olympics.

visitedCities.name: Zermatt
visitedCities.description: Iconic Swiss Alpine village at the foot of the Matterhorn, renowned for skiing, mountaineering, and car-free streets.

visitedCities.name: Jeju
visitedCities.description: Volcanic island province of South Korea, famous for its natural beauty, beaches, hiking trails, and unique women divers called haenyeo.

visitedCities.name: Kyoto
visitedCities.description: Former imperial capital of Japan, renowned for its thousands of temples, traditional wooden houses, and preserved geisha districts.

visitedCities.name: Florence
visitedCities.description: Renaissance capital of Italy, birthplace of the Renaissance and home to masterpieces by Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci, and Botticelli.

visitedCities.name: Vik
visitedCities.description: Small coastal village in southern Iceland, famous for its dramatic black sand beaches, basalt sea stacks, and Northern Lights viewing.

visitedCities.name: Puebla
visitedCities.description: Historic colonial city in central Mexico, UNESCO World Heritage site known for its baroque architecture, Talavera pottery, and mole cuisine.

visitedCities.name: Eskilstuna
visitedCities.description: Historic industrial city in central Sweden, known for its steel production heritage, Parken Zoo, and beautiful lakeside setting.

visitedCities.name: Geneva
visitedCities.description: International city in Switzerland, home to the United Nations and Red Cross, known for its lake, luxury watches, and diplomatic importance.

visitedCities.name: Zurich
visitedCities.description: Switzerland's largest city and financial center, known for its banking industry, high quality of life, and beautiful lakeside setting.

visitedCities.name: Mumbai
visitedCities.description: India's financial capital and largest city, known as the 'City of Dreams' for its Bollywood film industry, bustling markets, and colonial architecture.

visitedCities.name: Raglan
visitedCities.description: Laid-back surf town on New Zealand's North Island, famous for its world-class left-hand surf breaks, black sand beaches, and bohemian atmosphere.

visitedCities.name: Queenstown
visitedCities.description: Adventure capital of New Zealand, nestled on the shores of Lake Wakatipu and surrounded by dramatic mountains, known for bungee jumping, skiing, and stunning scenery.
